author: @DarrenSemotiuk
text: Thanks! Very helpful! I just did the same thing in my Windows version of SublimeText 3, and added annotations to explain each line for Future Me: // ALT-LeftClick to 'Goto Definition' // filename:		"Default (Windows).sublime-mousemap" // inside this path:	"<sublime root>\Data\Packages\User" [{ 	"button": "button1",		// button1 = LEFT mouse click 	"count": 1,			/* 2 would make DOUBLE-click required (hmmm...) */ 	"modifiers": ["alt"],		// ALT not CTRL (since CTRL = multi-select, Sublime's BEST feature!) 	"press_command": "drag_select",	// will auto-expand to the full token (e.g. function name) 	"command": "goto_definition",	// Where The Magic Happens, "Goto Definition" = another of Sublime's best features  }]

author: @malharjajoo7393
text: How would you do this for ubuntu ?

author: @ravendcode9883
text: Add the below settings to the file C:\Users\USERNAME\AppData\Roaming\Sublime Text 3\Packages\User\Default (Windows).sublime-mousemap  [  {   "button": "button1",   "count": 1,   "modifiers": ["ctrl"],   "press_command": "drag_select",   "command": "goto_definition"  },  {   "button": "button2",   "count": 1,   "modifiers": ["ctrl"],   "press_command": "jump_back",   "command": "jump_back"  } ] You can now click ctrl + left click to go to definition and click ctrl + right click to return. http://blog.my-helper.com/sublime-text/sublime-text-3-mouse-click-goto-definition/
